entry.title: 3.0 kWh Solar Generator
entry.content:
This project was from the beginning of 2021. It took around 40 hours over a few months.

Most of the project is based on LithiumSolar's video.

Recycled 2200 mAh modem cells were sourced from batteryhookup.com. Iâ€™ve sourced some 2600 mAh cells, but not the 364 required for this project. The total storage of the generator ended up being a little less than 3.0 kWh after testing all cells.

A kWeld was used for spot welding. 4P nickel strip was sourced to simplify connections for each parallel group.

entry.title: CO2 Monitor
entry.content:
Inspiration for this project was Makezine article and blog post "Fresh Air" and Adafruit's SCD-30 sensor page.

A lot of interest in indoor CO2 monitoring was sparked by a professor that built a CO2 monitor for his classroom. He found that the CO2 levels at the end of class were enough to make you groggy/sleepy and therefore not able to learn as well.

One interesting discovery was how high CO2 levels get in a short drive with windows up. My car, a Nissan Sentra, approached 2000 ppm in a one-person 30-minute commute. Having one window down @55 MPH (90 KPH) for a minute brought the levels back to below 1000 ppm.
